instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.5V_S4: What is 5V_S4? This is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S4” – when you see this, assume the person typing it meant to type “PP5V_S4”.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Not Turning On
threads.message:
This mac came from another service with flux on <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR>, PCH Done reflow, and other components.


Voltage:

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.6V; <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> 4.3V; <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> 3.35V; <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3.35V ;<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> 51mV, pulsing.

The fan rotates in SMC bypass mode.



diode mode;

L7630 0.088V
L7870 0.020V
L7330 0.019V
L7320 0,020V
L7310 0,174V
L7520 0,425V
L7195 0,335V
L3095 0,533V

Coil voltage;

L7630 0.485V
L7870 1.5V
L7330 0V, no pulse
L7320 0V, no pulse
L7310 0V, no pulse
L7560 3.35V
L7520 4.35V
L7195 5.5V
L3095 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Not Turning On
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>5V_S4</SIGNAL> looks too low; did you check it at <CAPACITOR>C7552</CAPACITOR>/4?
Check all components in that area, especially <RESISTOR>R7520</RESISTOR>/21/45 and <CAPACITOR>C7524</CAPACITOR>.
Be sure all solders and traces are good.

You have a problem with <SIGNAL>1V05_S0</SIGNAL> power supply.
Check all around <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> and L/<TRANSISTOR>Q7630</TRANSISTOR>; pay atention to R/<CAPACITOR>C7630</CAPACITOR>.
